Initialization method

Source: R/zzz_VI_MODEL.R
HETER_MODEL-cash-..init...Rd

This function will be called after an instance is built. User input will be stored in the environment. The response variable of this model is y. The formula of y is defined in HETER_MODEL$formula, the null formula is defined in HETER_MODEL$null_formula, the formula for sigma is defined in HETER_MODEL$sigma_formula, the formula for e is defined in HETER_MODEL$e_formula.

Arguments

a

Numeric. Default is a = 0.

b

Numeric. Default is b = 1.

x

Random variable or closed form expression. Default is x = rand_uniform(-1, 1, env = new.env(parent = parent.env(self))).

Value

No return value, called for side effects.

Examples


# Instantiation
test <- heter_model(a = 0, b = 20)

test
#> 
#> ── <HETER_MODEL object>
#> y = 1 + x + e
#>  - x: <RAND_UNIFORM object>
#>    [a: -1, b: 1]
#>  - e: <CLOSED_FORM object>
#>    EXPR = RAND_NORMAL[["gen"]](length(sigma), mu = 0, sigma = sigma)
#>     - sigma: <CLOSED_FORM object>
#>       EXPR = sqrt(1 + (2 - abs(a)) * (x - a)^2 * b)
#>        - x: <RAND_UNIFORM object>
#>          [a: -1, b: 1]
#>  - a: 0
#>  - b: 20 

# Generate data
test$gen(10)
#>             y           x    sigma           e
#> 1   1.7793658 -0.08800384 1.144459  0.86736965
#> 2  -3.2245969  0.59815157 3.912980 -4.82274851
#> 3   0.6759357 -0.75871213 4.901608  0.43464786
#> 4   0.9756263  0.29150011 2.097354 -0.31587384
#> 5   0.4149834  0.47374802 3.158716 -1.05876461
#> 6  -3.9983452 -0.39089637 2.666833 -4.60744883
#> 7   1.0209422  0.07250928 1.100138 -0.05156705

#> 9   0.2498279 -0.26816265 1.968870 -0.48200943
#> 10  0.2068077  0.04418307 1.038309 -0.83737540
